intro: Cadetia arfakensis, commonly known as the Arfakense rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Indonesia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and the plant produces small, round pods that contain several seeds.
